snippet: The air of celebration at Sweet Briar College’s commencement was laced with melancholy, frustration and trepidation because the all-women’s institution is set to close in August.
abstract: Sweet Briar College in Virginia holds its commencement ceremony, joyous day overshadowed by ongoing battle over plans by all-women's school to close its doors in August; battle between faculty and administration is so heated that interim president James F Jones chooses not to attend ceremony at all, responding to threats from some faculty members and alumni to disrupt graduation should he preside.

byline.contributor: Sheryl Gay Stolberg contributed reporting from Washington.

lead_paragraph: The air of celebration at Sweet Briar College’s commencement was laced with melancholy, frustration and trepidation because the all-women’s institution is set to close in August.

headline.main: Graduation Is Bittersweet as Sweet Briar College Is Likely to Close
headline.print_headline: Graduation Is Bittersweet at College Likely to Close
